The awakening of religious and sectarian identities dominant at the expense of Lebanese identity, Arabism and the national state at the same time is a recipe for permanent civil wars

The delusion of transnationalism and entities and the abolition of borders in the face of international jihad, sectarian victory, or involvement in an external conflict leading to the demise of the state and the homeland
The more the Lebanese are neutral and neutral, and they drift in the game of axes, the compromise and the charter of assassination, and the eruptions of the volcanoes
It is not permissible under the pretext of any internal issue, to legislate the doors for interference by external parties or to establish external projects
Any weapon outside the state system and the unity of its decision becomes part of the tools of the struggle for power or hegemony or a reserve force to price disputes and civil wars

The duty to approach the issue of weapons, based on the approach of dialogue and the logic of the state, away from the logic of accusation and skepticism and policies of isolation or hegemony and abolition
Not to succumb to the temptations of extension or vacuum trap in institutions at all levels, especially in the position of the presidency, the symbol of one nation
I call on the deputies to assume their responsibilities and not to deny the agency granted by the people to secure a quorum for the election and avoid the danger of presidential vacuum
A homeland ruled by delicate scales does not tolerate extreme choices at the level of men and beliefs and requires moderation, courage and wisdom at all levels of government
Any president who is entrusted with the constitution needs, in addition to raising the tone, the voice and the ceiling of demands, to provide the necessary requirements for his political vision
Any President entrusted with the Constitution needs to provide the requirements for success of his political vision, especially by clarifying the powers entrusted to the President of the Republic

The president of Lebanon derives his strength not from his sect or his party, nor from the street or the alliances of the outside, or by focusing his attention and efforts on picking the success of a popular policy for his benefit
No one has ever kneeled to the National Assembly, the Supreme Court, which has emerged from that Assembly, and will not be able to kneel after this.
